rules.natural: Either John works on Project A or John works on Project B.
Provided that an employee has access to files, the employee is logged in to the system.
Whenever an employee is late for work, that employee misses a deadline.
Given that a manager attended the meeting, if an employee is sitting on the office chair, the employee is not comfortable.
If John works on Project B, then an employee is employed.
The existence of a conflict between an employee and a manager leads to the conflict being resolved.
A conflict between an employee and a manager implies that the conflict is not resolved.
An employee working remotely implies that the computer is not connected to the network.
Either a manager approved remote work or a manager denied remote work.
If a manager denied remote work, then whenever an employee is using a computer, the employee is working remotely.
Whenever the HR department reviewed a request, if a manager approved remote work, then an employee using a computer implies that the employee is working remotely.
Either the HR department reviewed a request or the HR department processed a request.

A request being finalized implies that if the HR department processed the request, then under the condition that a manager approved remote work, an employee using a computer leads to the employee working remotely.
A request is pending or a request is finalized.
The conference room is available, or if John works on Project A, then an employee is employed.
An employee receiving a warning implies that the employee is not fired.
If an employee submitted a complaint, then the employee is not terminated.
Either an employee submitted a complaint or the HR department investigated a complaint.
Provided that the HR department investigated a complaint, the HR department documented the complaint.
A complaint being valid implies that the employee is not terminated.
A complaint being resolved implies that the complaint is valid.
Under the condition that the HR department followed procedure, if the HR department documented a complaint, then the complaint is resolved.
An employee sitting on the office chair implies that the employee is comfortable.
An employee is sitting on the office chair or the conference room is not available.
An employee reporting the office chair as broken implies that if the chair is broken, then the employee is not sitting on it.
An employee using a computer leads to the employee having access to files.
Whenever an employee is using a computer, the computer is connected to the network.
An employee being logged in to the system implies that the computer is not connected to the network.
If it is not the case that missing a deadline implies the employee is not fired, then the employee is promoted.
If it is not the case that a manager preparing for the meeting leads to the meeting being productive, then there is a conflict between an employee and a manager.
Provided that it is not true that the absence of a scheduled meeting implying manager attendance results in the meeting being rescheduled, a manager prepared for the meeting.
If it is not the case that an employee not being employed implies the employee received a warning, then the employee is terminated.
An employee not being employed implies that the employee is fired.
If an employee is not employed, then the employee is late for work.
Provided that an employee is not employed, the employee is using a computer.

It is not the case that an employee is promoted.

(A1 → G).natural: If John works on Project A, then an employee is employed.

(A1 ∨ A2).natural: Either John works on Project A or John works on Project B.

(A10 → A9).natural: Provided that an employee has access to files, the employee is logged in to the system.

(A12 → A13).natural: Whenever an employee is late for work, that employee misses a deadline.

(A12 → ¬A11).natural: An employee being late for work implies that the employee is not fired.

(A13 → ¬A11).natural: If an employee misses a deadline, then it is not the case that the employee is fired.

(A16 → (A4 → ¬A15)).natural: Under the condition that a meeting is scheduled, if an employee is sitting on the office chair, then the employee is not comfortable.

(A16 → A17).natural: A meeting being scheduled implies that a manager attended the meeting.

(A17 → (A4 → ¬A15)).natural: Given that a manager attended the meeting, if an employee is sitting on the office chair, the employee is not comfortable.

(A2 → G).natural: If John works on Project B, then an employee is employed.

(A20 → A19).natural: A manager preparing for the meeting results in the meeting being productive.

(A21 → A22).natural: The existence of a conflict between an employee and a manager leads to the conflict being resolved.

(A21 → ¬A22).natural: A conflict between an employee and a manager implies that the conflict is not resolved.

(A23 → ¬A8).natural: An employee working remotely implies that the computer is not connected to the network.

(A24 → (A7 → A23)).natural: Under the condition that a manager approved remote work, if an employee is using a computer, then the employee is working remotely.

(A24 ∨ A25).natural: Either a manager approved remote work or a manager denied remote work.

(A25 → (A7 → A23)).natural: If a manager denied remote work, then whenever an employee is using a computer, the employee is working remotely.

(A26 → (A24 → (A7 → A23))).natural: Whenever the HR department reviewed a request, if a manager approved remote work, then an employee using a computer implies that the employee is working remotely.

(A26 ∨ A27).natural: Either the HR department reviewed a request or the HR department processed a request.

(A27 → (A24 → (A7 → A23))).natural: Provided that the HR department processed a request, if a manager approved remote work, then an employee using a computer results in the employee working remotely.

(A28 → (A27 → (A24 → (A7 → A23)))).natural: A request being finalized implies that if the HR department processed the request, then under the condition that a manager approved remote work, an employee using a computer leads to the employee working remotely.

(A29 ∨ A28).natural: A request is pending or a request is finalized.

(A3 ∨ (A1 → G)).natural: The conference room is available, or if John works on Project A, then an employee is employed.

(A30 → ¬A11).natural: An employee receiving a warning implies that the employee is not fired.

(A32 → ¬A31).natural: If an employee submitted a complaint, then the employee is not terminated.

(A32 ∨ A33).natural: Either an employee submitted a complaint or the HR department investigated a complaint.

(A33 → A34).natural: The HR department investigating a complaint leads to the complaint being valid.

(A33 → A35).natural: Provided that the HR department investigated a complaint, the HR department documented the complaint.

(A33 → ¬A31).natural: If the HR department investigated a complaint, then it is not the case that the employee is terminated.

(A34 → ¬A31).natural: A complaint being valid implies that the employee is not terminated.

(A35 → A34).natural: The HR department documenting a complaint results in the complaint being valid.

(A35 → A36).natural: If the HR department documented a complaint, then the complaint is resolved.

(A36 → A34).natural: A complaint being resolved implies that the complaint is valid.

(A37 → (A35 → A36)).natural: Under the condition that the HR department followed procedure, if the HR department documented a complaint, then the complaint is resolved.

(A4 → A15).natural: An employee sitting on the office chair implies that the employee is comfortable.

(A4 → ¬A15).natural: If an employee is sitting on the office chair, then the employee is not comfortable.

(A4 ∨ ¬A3).natural: An employee is sitting on the office chair or the conference room is not available.

(A5 → ¬A4).natural: The office chair being broken implies that an employee is not sitting on the office chair.

(A6 → (A5 → ¬A4)).natural: An employee reporting the office chair as broken implies that if the chair is broken, then the employee is not sitting on it.

(A7 → A10).natural: An employee using a computer leads to the employee having access to files.

(A7 → A23).natural: Provided that an employee is using a computer, the employee is working remotely.

(A7 → A8).natural: Whenever an employee is using a computer, the computer is connected to the network.

(A7 → A9).natural: An employee using a computer implies that the employee is logged in to the system.

(A7 → ¬A8).natural: If an employee is using a computer, then the computer is not connected to the network.

(A9 → ¬A8).natural: An employee being logged in to the system implies that the computer is not connected to the network.

(¬(A13 → ¬A11) → A14).natural: If it is not the case that missing a deadline implies the employee is not fired, then the employee is promoted.

(¬(A16 → A17) → A18).natural: If it is not true that a meeting being scheduled implies a manager attended the meeting, then the meeting is rescheduled.

(¬(A20 → A19) → A21).natural: If it is not the case that a manager preparing for the meeting leads to the meeting being productive, then there is a conflict between an employee and a manager.

(¬(¬(A16 → A17) → A18) → A19).natural: If it is not the case that the failure of a meeting being scheduled to imply a manager attended leads to the meeting being rescheduled, then the meeting is productive.

(¬(¬(A16 → A17) → A18) → A20).natural: Provided that it is not true that the absence of a scheduled meeting implying manager attendance results in the meeting being rescheduled, a manager prepared for the meeting.

(¬(¬G → A30) → A31).natural: If it is not the case that an employee not being employed implies the employee received a warning, then the employee is terminated.

(¬G → A11).natural: An employee not being employed implies that the employee is fired.

(¬G → A12).natural: If an employee is not employed, then the employee is late for work.

(¬G → A30).natural: An employee not being employed leads to the employee receiving a warning.

(¬G → A7).natural: Provided that an employee is not employed, the employee is using a computer.

(¬G → ¬A11).natural: An employee not being employed implies that the employee is not fired.

A6.natural: An employee reported the office chair as broken.

¬A14.natural: It is not the case that an employee is promoted.

¬A21.natural: There is no conflict between an employee and a manager.

¬A3.natural: The conference room is not available.

¬A4.natural: An employee is not sitting on the office chair.

¬A7.natural: An employee is not using a computer.
